Posts.Content: Hi T10 i had a masectomy and lymph removal in Feb, so slightly different op, but found some bras in Asda (post surgery ones) which were soft and minimal seems... not too bad £££ wise either, might be worth a look? i did live in vest tops as well though with the support in (m&s)  and still do so now some days!  Good luck!
Posts.Title: Bras!!!

Posts.Content: Thank you Rosie! wow they moved quickly then if you had first one the next day! Thank you so much for sharing your experience..aware that other hospitals might be different.  I was told 2-3 weeks after appt I’d get first chemo... but they said that about this first appointment which has come through a week later!  No no doubt I’ll be back with more questions that I didn’t ask at the time....
Posts.Title: ***March 2019 Breast Cancer Chem Chat ***

Posts.Content: Hi,  Ive got my first oncology appointment on Wednesday this week after being  ‘signed of’ by my Breast care consultant... can anyone give me an indication of what to expect at the first appointment?  Thansk in advance...
Posts.Title: ***March 2019 Breast Cancer Chem Chat ***

Posts.Content: Hi all... looking to get peoples experiences, appreciate they will all be different but how long after finishing chemo was it before you started radiotherapy?  Im currently having chemo, (EC then docetaxel) and have been told I will need radiotherapy afterwards, but didn’t think to ask at the time how long it will be after finishing chemo  before I start radiotherapy.... so would appreciate any experiences!  Ive left a message for the Breast care nurses, but they’re not the best at calling back form experience, and with it being a bank holiday i suspect it will be even longer! I do have an oncologist appt on Thursday, but don’t like waiting !  Many thanks..
Posts.Title: Timeframes between chemo and radiotherapy

Posts.Content: Hi Sunshine45 and Horsing Around thanks for for your responses.. that’s what I was hoping to hear so fingers crossed I.m the same!
Posts.Title: Timeframes between chemo and radiotherapy

Posts.Content: I really don't get it. Our oncology dept in Bristol have a massage service whilst you have your infusion. I too have decided more pampering is the way forward after such dark days so would be intrigued to know why.
Posts.Title: NO Massages for 5 years!!!

Posts.Content: Hi Janice, I haven't been through this but I just wanted to wish you luck and hope the results aren't what you a fearing. Claire x
